fields.physical_description:
[Saddle bag] WARP: brown and cream wool (mixed); Z2S; 20 threads to the inch (90 per dm).

WEFT: red wool; Z spun, unplied; 2 shoots after each row of knots; 13 knots to the inch (50 per dm).

PILE: wool; 9 colours: dark red, red, yellow, dark green, light green, dark blue, blue, dark brown, white; asymmetrical knot open to the left, tied around 2 warp threads; 130 knots to the sq. inch (2250 per sq. dm).

SIDE FINISH: both sides have one cord oversewn with blue wool.

END FINISH: Lower: a 1cm band divided into small blocks of blue and white weft twining, and then cut.  Upper: 1 pass of blue/white wool; band of 8 blocks of chevrons 3/4" (2 cm) deep in weft twining with weft reversed to create slits, in blue/brown, red/blue, brown/white, yellow/dark red; 1 cm band of small red/blue blocks; 2 passes of red/blue wool in weft twining to create chevron and then 1 cm of plain weave with red wool turned and stitched.

DESIGN: field: dark blue ground with central hooked diamond containing small geometric figures.  There is a hooked and stepped cross in each corner.  The field is filled with geometric motifs and animals.

Main border: white ground with 'S' shapes on either side of a bracket (a form of the leaf and wineglass design?).

Inner and outer border: reciprocal blue/red triangles

NB the proportions of some of the motifs vary from one bag face to the other.
[Saddle bag] WARP: brown wool mixed with cream; Z2S; 20 threads to the inch (90 per dm).  Some warp threads paired tightly together in second band of weft twinning at lower end and then released into pile.  Warp expands in side borders for 10 1/2"   (27 cm) from the bottom of the piece.

WEFT: red wool; Z-spun, unplied; an area 9 1/2" (24 cm) deep in the lower part of light pink cotton; Z2S; 2 parallel threads per shoot with cotton as the first shoot and sometimes additionally the third; usually 2 shoots after each row of knots; 13 knots to the inch (50 per dm).

PILE: wool; 11 colours: dark red, red, yellow, dark green, green, light green, dark blue, blue, very light blue, brown, white; asymmetrical knot open to the left and tied around 2 warp threads; 130 knots to the sq. inch (2250 per sq. dm).

SIDE FINISH: both sides have one cord oversewn with red wool with evidence of blocks of green, blue and white stitching that formerly would have joined the two parts of the bag.

END FINISH: Lower: band of 8 blocks of chevrons, 3/4" (2 cm) deep, in weft twinning, with weft reversed to create slits, in brown/very light blue, red/blue, blue/white, red/yellow, red/blue; above and below is a narrow band of decoration in red and blue weft twining, an outer, narrow band of red and blue chevrons in weft twining and then 1/2" (1.5 cm) of plain weave with red wool weft turned and stitched.  Upper: a band of blue and yellow 'S' motifs; then narrow and incomplete band of small blocks of blue and white; then cut.

DESIGN: field: dark blue ground with central hooked diamond containing small geometric figures.  There is a hooked and stepped cross in each corner.  The field is filled with geometric motifs and animals.

Main border: white ground with 'S' shapes on either side of a bracket (a form of the leaf and winegrlass design?).

Inner and outer border: reciprocal blue/red triangles.

NB: The proportions of some of the motifs vary from one bag face to the other.
fields.dimensions:
[Saddle bag] Length: 55 cm max, Length: 53 cm min, Width: 63.5 cm max, Width: 55 cm min
[Saddle bag] Length: 56 cm, Width: 63.5 cm max, Width: 61 cm min
fields.history_note:
[Saddle bag] See comment (Allgrove Qashgai 1976) circ. 992-1926

cf. Woven Gardens 1976.   this 'hooked diamond at least since 1875.  Reminiscent of Turkish Girl, plate 17.
Warp: wool Z2S
Weft: wool Z
Pile: wool, Z2 asymmetrical, opening to the left#
Selvedge: cable of 5 warps.

Related Material:
Dennis R Dodds Qashgai Khorjins in Philadelphia
Hali: 5 (IV) 1983 p. 446> with structural details p. 449
[Saddle bag] cf: Allgrove.  Qashgai 1976. H43 (illus. 39a) as lent by David Black - also saddle bag face.  Given as wool and goathair warp S spun; weft wool S.  Similar compos. especially of central motif but different corner motifs.
